required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Micro-osteoperforations To Reduce Orthodontic Treatment Duration: Randomised Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose is to compare orthodontic treatment duration from start until the completion of orthodontic treatment and to investigate the presence of root resorption, gingival recession,anchorage loss, black triangle and pain assessment after orthodontic treatment duration between micro-osteoperforations group and control group.

detailed_description.textblock: Prolonged treatment time in orthodontics is an undesirable side effect for both the patient and clinician. Usually, an average course of comprehensive orthodontic treatment with fixed appliances requires less than 2 years to complete (19.9 months). This prolonged treatment time may cause adverse effects such as root resorption, gingival recession, caries & enamel demineralization. Micro-osteoperforations is safe, minimally invasive technique which perforations are performed through the gum tissues, penetrating the bone without the need to raise a ﬂap.Control group will not received any MOP and will receive standard orthodontic treatment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Method of randomization using online software at www.randomizer.org and the 30 participants will be randomly allocated into 2 intervention groups with a 1:1 allocation. Patient will be grouped into either group 1 (control group, no micro- osteoperforations given) or group 2 (micro-osteoperforations with frequency interval 4 weeks maxilla and mandible) . Thus, each group will have a total of 15 participants. In order to reduce bias during allocating the participants into group 1 or 2, the 30 numbers will subsequently cross match with the computer generated random numbers list also using www.randomizer.org. concealment of the allocation sequence will be done by concealing the sequence in opaque envelopes,shuffled and chosen by patient prior to the intervention.
study_design_info.masking_description: Blinding of either patient or clinician is not possible during allocation, treatment and data collection. However, blinding can be ensured during data processing, analysing stages and data collection for secondary outcomes on total volume of root resorption, radiographic assessment on black triangle, pain and measurement of anchorage loss.

primary_outcome.measure: Total treatment time to align the lower labial segment ( 33-43) in micro-osteoperforations vs the control group
primary_outcome.description: Total treatment time needed to achieved lower labial segment alignment at 5months time

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of orthodontic tooth movement during en-masse retraction of upper labial segment in space closure in micro-osteoperforations vs the control group
primary_outcome.description: Amount of tooth movement recorded using digital caliper from the start of space closure at 4 weeks interval

primary_outcome.measure: Total orthodontic treatment duration needed between micro-osteoperforations and control group
primary_outcome.description: Overall time of orthodontic treatment will be assessed by calculating the total months from bonding to debond stage

primary_outcome.measure: Total orthodontic treatment duration needed for en-masse retraction upper labial segment between MOPs and control group
primary_outcome.description: Total time need to complete space closure from inital canine retraction to end of space closure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total volume of root resorption with micro-osteoperforations group vs the control group
secondary_outcome.description: Total volume of root resorption in cubic millimeter (mm3) using 3D Cone Beam CT imaging scanner compare at baseline and end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gingival recession between micro-osteoperforations and control group.
secondary_outcome.description: Gingival recession assessed in millimetre (mm) from cement-enamel junction (CEJ) to free gingival margin using electric digital calliper with an accuracy of 0.01mm, at baseline and end of orthodontic treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Black triangle between micro-osteoperforations and control group.
secondary_outcome.description: The total volume interdental bone in cubic millimeter (mm3)assessed using 3D Cne Beam CT imaging, for interdental bone changes at baseline and end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anchorage loss between micro-osteoperforations and control group
secondary_outcome.description: Total amount of foward movement of upper 5's assessed at baseline and end of orthodontic treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain perception between mico-osteoperforations and control group.
secondary_outcome.description: Global pain scale will be given upon completion of orthodontic treatment. patient will rate their pain 0=no pain to 10=worse pain

arm_group.description: Lower arch, 2 MOPs vertically at interdental area bilaterally mesial to lower 6's ; mesial to lower 1st premolar; mesial to lower 2's and between the lower 1's.The 7 locations for perforations will be repeated 4 weekly until the completion of treatment. Upper arch , 2 MOPs vertically,bilaterally at the buccal aspect on the cortical bone between the 1's and distal to the 2's during levelling and alignment, repeated every 4 weekly until completion of treatment. MOPs at the extraction site of the upper arch will be started one month post extraction of upper 4's until completion of treatment. The exact location for MOPs insertion as following: the first point will be placed 6mm from the free gingival margin, and the second point will be placed 5mm from the first point.
Conventional orthodontic treatment without any aid in tooth acceleration method / device

intervention.description: MOPs will be performed using SIA Excalibur Mini-Implant with dimension 1.6 mm in width and length of 6 mm, screw 3 mm depth into buccal bone of intervention sites

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gender : Male and Female
- Age range : ≥ 18years to 45 years old
- Crowding of 3mm - 7mm on lower labial segment (lower right canine to lower left canine) which does not require extractions in the lower arch
- Class II div I Incisor relationship with extraction of both upper 1st premolars
- Maximum anchorage control with temporary anchorage device ( TAD) , with Molar Class II (¼ to full unit) malocclusion
- Average vertical facial proportions
- No systemic disease
- Acceptable good oral hygiene
- No periodontal disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smokers
- Distally angulated canines
- History of trauma (crown fracture or avulsion and re-implantation) , endodontic treatment
- Missing permanent mandibular anterior teeth ( Hypodontia) / Retained deciduous teeth in mandibular anterior area
- Habits eg: fingernails biting , toothpick user , using hard toothbrush
- Vertical skeletal discrepancies eg high angle and low angle
- Systemic disease especially on long term use of antibiotics, phenytoin, cyclosporin, anti-inflammatory drugs, systemic corticosteroid and calcium channel blockers
- Poor oral hygiene for more than 3 visits
- Current periodontal disease
